articles.title: Biden Sees Top Foes Join Forces in North Korea, Iran Sending Arms to Russia
articles.description: Responding to Newsweek, the National Security Council's John Kirby said "there is greater concern" now that three top U.S. rivals appear to be working together.

articles.title: Why Madonna Is the 'Villain' of Weird Al Yankovic Biopic
articles.description: Speaking with Newsweek, actor Evan Rachel Wood said the pop icon was "just running circles around everybody."
articles.content:
It seems that Evan Rachel Wood had fun playing Madonna in Weird: The Al Yankovic Story, describing her own performance as the "mustache-twirling version" of the larger-than-life pop icon.

articles.title: В США оценили последствия оговорок Байдена во Флориде
articles.description: В своей речи во Флориде президент США Джо Байден сделал много ошибок, которые затмили всю идею его послания. Об этом во вторник, 2 ноября, заявил старший корреспондент Newsweek Ник Рейнольдс.

articles.title: Eva Green: James Bond Producer Will 'Make the Right Choice' for Future
articles.description: Actor Eva Green spoke with Newsweek about her character in the 2006 film "Casino Royale," and why Vesper Lynd still haunts James Bond in recent films.
articles.content:
Eva Green played Vesper Lynd in the James Bond film Casino Royale in 2006, and though she only appeared in the one film, Green said she is confident that the future of the series remains in good hands.

articles.title: Without Trump, Democrats and Republicans Struggle to Maintain Enthusiasm
articles.description: "Politics is just different without Trump being center stage," Gallup's director of U.S. social research told Newsweek.
articles.content:
Voter enthusiasm is down compared to the 2018 midterm elections, and former President Donald Trump may be the reason Democrats and Republicans are struggling to engage the electorate.

articles.title: Ukraine Allies Can't Give In to Putin's Demands for Ending War
articles.description: "It's a test—they want to see how close the West would be to actually engaging with them," Northwestern's William Reno told Newsweek.
articles.content:
The Kremlin has suggested that negotiations could be on the table to end the war in Ukraine, but Russian President Vladimir Putin's demands are putting the West in a bind that is unlikely to result in a cease-fire.

articles.title: Comedian Weighs In on Consequences of Joke Stealing Amid James Corden Drama
articles.description: Veteran comedy writer Jeffrey L. Gurian spoke to Newsweek about having one of his own jokes stolen, and discusses the incident between Corden and Ricky Gervais.
articles.content:
If a writer at The Late Late Show intentionally gave James Corden Ricky Gervais' joke, he'd be fired and "blackballed" according to comedian Jeffrey L. Gurian.

articles.title: Woman Turns Up To Surprise Wedding Wearing Incredible Halloween Costume
articles.description: Newsweek spoke to the Reddit user who said: "It was the most fun and silliest wedding ever."
articles.content:
A woman who turned up to a surprise wedding dressed up in a hilarious Halloween costume has gone viral.

articles.title: How MAGA Election Watchers Are Scaring Away Voters
articles.description: It's "a small faction of extremists" that "are trying to scare voters away from ballot boxes," Alex Gulotta, of nonprofit All Voting is Local, told Newsweek.
articles.content:
People with guns standing watch at ballot boxes. Voters being filmed or harassed as they go to cast their ballot. They're images reminiscent of life under an authoritarian regime, not a reflection of modern-day America.
